ca.mcgill.ecse211.team4.drivers

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.team4.drivers.Navigation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Thread
    Drives the robot to given waypoints using the shortest path.
    Author:
    Walid Chabchoub & Kevin Laframboise

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Navigation(Odometer odo, EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor, EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor)
      Creates a Navigation object that will drive the given motors to a waypoint, according to the position of the robot reported by the odometer.

      (package private) boolean isNavigating() 
      (package private) void pause()
      Stops the motors and signals the Navigation algorithm that another process is taking over the driving of the robot by setting isAvoiding to true.

      Resumes the navigation by setting isAvoiding to false.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Navigation

        public Navigation(Odometer odo,
                  EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                  EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor)
        Creates a Navigation object that will drive the given motors to a waypoint, according to the position of the robot reported by the odometer.
        Parameters:
        odo - odometer tracking the robot's movements.
        leftMotor - to be driven by Navigation.
        rightMotor - to be driven by Navigation.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
        See Also:
        Thread.run()

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
                     double y,
                     boolean immediateReturn)
        Travels to the given waypoint.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate in cm.
        y - y-coordinate in cm.
        immediateReturn - dictates whether the method should return immediately or wait for the motor movements to finish.

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        Turns to given heading using the minimum angle.
        Parameters:
        theta - heading in radians.

      • turn

        public void turn(double dTheta,
                 java.lang.String direction)
        Turns in given direction.
        Parameters:
        dTheta - change in heading wanted, in degrees.
        direction - left or right.

      • isNavigating

        boolean isNavigating()
        Returns:
        isNavigating

      • pause

        void pause()
        Stops the motors and signals the Navigation algorithm that another process is taking over the driving of the robot by setting isAvoiding to true.

      • resumeNav

        void resumeNav()
        Resumes the navigation by setting isAvoiding to false.

      • update

        public void update()
        Indicates to navigation that a recalculation of the path is required.

      • getWaypointX

        public double getWaypointX()
        Returns:
        current x waypoint.

      • getWaypointY

        public double getWaypointY()
        Returns:
        current y waypoint.

      • setWaypoints

        public void setWaypoints(double x,
                         double y)
        Sets the destination of the navigation. This overwrites the previous destination.
        Parameters:
        x - in cm
        y - in cm

      • isAvoiding

        public boolean isAvoiding()
        Returns:
        isAvoiding
